title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools implemented a partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit ending in June.
The freeze affects both school-based and Central Office positions, exempting roles that directly serve students, said Superintendent Mary Skipper.
Three schools will close by 2027, potentially resulting in 300 to 400 teacher and paraprofessional job cuts due to decreased enrollment.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Will Campbell entertains teammates with SNL-style 'Weekend Updates' during Friday meetings, easing the grind of film study.
Campbell's humorous antics at a Celtics game, including a beer chug, won crowd approval and went viral online.
Despite injury setbacks, Campbell's performance elevated the Patriots' offensive line, earning recognition from Pro Football Focus.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Mela Rosario, 17, from Dorchester, went missing after last being seen near a Brockton courthouse on Jan. 29.
Rosario is 5'1", with brown skin, medium build, brown eyes, medium-length brown hair with a blonde streak.
She last wore a pink jacket, black leggings, brown Uggs, and glasses with clear black frames; police ask for public help.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty criticized the Hall of Fame process, calling Belichick and Kraft's omission a 'travesty.'
Belichick and Kraft were on a ballot with L.C. Greenwood, Roger Craig, and Ken Anderson for Canton enshrinement.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics trade Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
The trade reduces Boston's luxury tax penalty from $39.5M to $17.7M by exchanging Simons' $27.7M salary for Vučević's $21.5M.
Vučević averages 16.9 points and 9.0 rebounds, bolstering Boston's frontcourt, which is currently led by Neemias Queta and Luka Garza.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel expressed disappointment over Robert Kraft not making the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class.
Robert Kraft was part of a five-man ballot but did not advance into the Hall of Fame class.
Kraft has been eligible for Hall of Fame enshrinement since 2013 but 2026 was his first semifinal advancement.

title: Families of Revere women who died in Belize hotel file wrongful death lawsuit against resort, Expedia
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Families of Wafae El-Arar, Kaoutar Naqqad, and Imane Mallah filed a wrongful death lawsuit following their 2025 Belize hotel deaths.
The lawsuit claims Royal Kahal Beach Resort ignored carbon monoxide warnings and lacked functional detectors, leading to the women's deaths.
Defendants include Royal Kahal, Expedia, the water heater manufacturer, and installation contractors; families seek $100 million in damages.

title: She’s running Boston to raise money for Homes For Our Troops
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Rebecca Ludwig, 34, from DeKalb County, GA, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Homes For Our Troops.
Her campaign supports building mortgage-free, specially adapted homes for severely injured veterans to regain independence.
Funds raised also provide veterans with ongoing financial planning assistance to maintain their homes sustainably.

title: Lawmakers urge Healey to  prepare for possible state prosecutions of federal officials
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: 23 state senators urged Gov. Maura Healey to prepare for state prosecutions of federal officials following alleged abuses.
Senators propose Healey create a task force to address federal abuse, coordinate agencies, and preserve evidence of misconduct.
Healey unveiled actions to limit ICE operating in Massachusetts, including barring them from schools and restricting National Guard deployment.

title: She’s running Boston to honor her sister — and the hospital that treated her
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hannah Orzechowski Murray, 31, from Malden, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her sister, Grace.
Grace was treated for glioblastoma at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute for two years before passing at age 24.
Murray is raising funds and awareness for Dana-Farber while also commemorating her sister's upcoming 30th birthday.
